item.description:
Join the Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Saturday evening to observe the flight of the Timberdoodle, the American Woodcock.  We will begin with a gathering at a campfire with hot dogs at the amphitheater behind the headquarters building in Carver beginning around 5:00 PM.

No dogs tonight please. But bring the kids they will love this!

BBQ Information Starting around 5:00 PM, we will light a campfire in the amphitheater behind the Headquarters. We will provide veggie dogs and hot dogs but you have to cook them yourself using the ol'-stick method. We will also have chips, condiments and drinks.

 

Glenn D'Entremont, our bird guru, will offer a quick introduction to what we are hoping to see.

At around 6:00 PM. we will drive over to the fields on Cutter Field Road where Glenn will lead us as we listen to and observe the flight display of the American Woodcock. (More info on the American Woodcock, including photos and audio of their call are available online.)  At this time of year these plump "shorebirds" with the funky bill and eyes which seem not to look forward arrive from the south and the males display for the females by performing an elaborate circular flight display and return to earth at the same spot where it began!  After it gets dark we can listen for owls, if the group wants to.

 

(photo courtesy of Frank Mand.)
item.how_to_find_us: The amphitheater is about 100 yards behind park headquarters. (Park at headquarters and follow the paved walkway.)

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Woodcock Walk
